Name: SPECIFIC PROCUREMENT NOTICE - 5140800 SELECTION OF AN IDIQ ENVIRONMENTAL, SOCIAL, HEALTH & SAFETY CONSULTANT
Scope:
Most tasks especially those related to construction monitoring and supervision will require close coordination and collaboration with other entities. Key to the success of this contract will be effective communication and close coordination with the PMC, which will serve as the design and supervisory engineer.  To that end, the consultant will:
1.	Closely coordinate and effectively communicate with MiDA, the PMC and other ESP consultants, jointly or separately as needed, to achieve effective management of HSE&S risks and opportunities. The ESH&S Consultant is expected to proactively identify ESH&S risks, mitigations options, and opportunities to improve project implementation.  
2.	During design, collaborate effectively with MiDA and the PMC, providing recommendations and inputs to minimize the health, safety, environment and social impacts or maximize the benefits.
3.	Participate in regular meetings with the PMC, other ESP consultants and/or MiDA.
MethodOfSubmission: PROPOSALS

Name: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO AWARD CONTRACT - 5610400 FIELD METERING AND MONITORING STUDIES
Scope: The Field Metering and Monitoring Studies will involve the study of Ghanaian households located in key population centers with disaggregation by income quintile and socio-demographic characteristics, including sex of the household head, age group, educational background, locality, etc. The aim is to conduct a study that best represents the appliance energy consumption and ownership patterns within statistical groupings that are defined by target cities, household income levels, and locality types, that best informs the policy and regulation making process associated with adoption of new and revision of existing Standards and Labels.

Name: SPECIFIC PROCUREMENT NOTICE - 5130400 METER MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (MMS) FOR ELECTRICITY COMPANY OF GHANA LIMITED (ECG)
Scope:
A Centralized Meter Management System (MMS) with enough capability for scalability to cover entire ECG operational Areas for the next ten (10) years and providing a joint infrastructure for a;
i)       Prepayment system based on Standard Transfer Specification (STS).
ii)	Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) system with head-ends for real time access to Smart Meters
iii)	Meter Data Management System (MDMS) that interfaces with all metering systems 
iv)     Design, Supply, Installation and Commissioning of Forty (40) Remote Vending Stations (RVS) based on an open protocol system and  interfacing with the MMS; The RVS provides access for vending, management, administration, financial and engineering control of Prepayment Meter systems. The RVS for the purposes of vending can be located at different places as per Consumer convenience.
v)	Capacity building and Training of ECG personnel on the use and maintenance of the system
MethodOfSubmission: PROPOSALS

Name: The Provision of Directional Drilling Services
Scope: The provision of this service is required to provide equipment and personnel to support directional drilling and completions operations. Formation Evaluation of Ghana wells (TEN and Jubilee) is predominantly performed through Logging While Drilling (LWD) services.   For all wells to be drilled the Bottom Hole Assembly (BHA) will include Gamma, Resistivity, Density, Neutron, Sonic and Formation pressures.  Drilling will be performed primarily with Rotary Steerable System (RSS) with mud motors as back up.   The Measurements While Drilling (MWD) system will include directional and inclination and annular pressure while drilling

Name: Request for Expressions of Interest- Supply and Delivery of Lubricants and Diesel Fuel
Scope:
Newmont’s Ahafo and Akyem mines are in full operation, with an estimated annual demand of low sulfur diesel and lubricants in excess of seventy (70) million and two (2) million litres, respectively

The company will undertake a tender process in the first quarter of 2018 and expects to award a contract for lubes and fuel supply and delivery during the second quarter of 2018.

Potential bidders will be required to prove that they can meet the following minimum criteria:
•	Ability to guarantee a continued secure supply of high quality diesel fuel with low sulfur content regulated to 50 parts per million (ppm) to meet schedule requirements of Newmont for operations.
•	QA/QC to effectively monitor, control, and report particle count in accordance with ISO 4406:1999 standard.
•	Demonstrated capability to transport lubes and fuel within Ghana in large volumes, safely and in full compliance with all applicable environmental and any other relevant standards.
•	Access to off-site storage capacity to allow holding of safety stocks in country exclusively for Newmont Ghana.
•	In country ability to provide temporary and secure lubes and fuel storage facilities at remote locations to support Newmont operations and projects together with electronic card reader capability.
•	Demonstrated financial capability to execute an agreement, including the provision of lubes and fuel on a consignment stock basis, at the Ahafo and Akyem mines.
•	Robust, effective and proven Health, Safety, and Environmental standards and procedures, including but not limited to emergency response capability.
•	Appropriate technical and commercial support, including potential future supply of bio-diesel, low sulphur and other low carbon emission products

Please express your interest in participating with Newmont in this bidding process by submitting an e-mail ASAP to VendorRegistration@Newmont.com, indicating the name of your company, contact person and cell-phone contact details.  You should briefly submit details demonstrating that you are able to comply with the above minimum criteria. 

Expressions of interest should be submitted to the above e-mail address by no later than close of business on 15 January 2018.

Name: Request for Expressions of Interest- Supply and Delivery of Lubricants and Diesel Fuel
Scope:
Newmont’s Ahafo and Akyem mines are in full operation, with an estimated annual demand of low sulfur diesel and lubricants in excess of seventy (70) million and two (2) million litres, respectively

The company will undertake a tender process in the first quarter of 2018 and expects to award a contract for lubes and fuel supply and delivery during the second quarter of 2018.

Potential bidders will be required to prove that they can meet the following minimum criteria:
•	Ability to guarantee a continued secure supply of high quality diesel fuel with low sulfur content regulated to 50 parts per million (ppm) to meet schedule requirements of Newmont for operations.
•	QA/QC to effectively monitor, control, and report particle count in accordance with ISO 4406:1999 standard.
•	Demonstrated capability to transport lubes and fuel within Ghana in large volumes, safely and in full compliance with all applicable environmental and any other relevant standards.
•	Access to off-site storage capacity to allow holding of safety stocks in country exclusively for Newmont Ghana.
•	In country ability to provide temporary and secure lubes and fuel storage facilities at remote locations to support Newmont operations and projects together with electronic card reader capability.
•	Demonstrated financial capability to execute an agreement, including the provision of lubes and fuel on a consignment stock basis, at the Ahafo and Akyem mines.
•	Robust, effective and proven Health, Safety, and Environmental standards and procedures, including but not limited to emergency response capability.
•	Appropriate technical and commercial support, including potential future supply of bio-diesel, low sulphur and other low carbon emission products

Please express your interest in participating with Newmont in this bidding process by submitting an e-mail ASAP to VendorRegistration@Newmont.com, indicating the name of your company, contact person and cell-phone contact details.  You should briefly submit details demonstrating that you are able to comply with the above minimum criteria. 

Expressions of interest should be submitted to the above e-mail address by no later than close of business on 15 January 2018.
MethodOfSubmission: Please express your interest in participating with Newmont in this bidding process by submitting an e-mail ASAP to VendorRegistration@Newmont.com, indicating the name of your company, contact person and cell-phone contact details.  You should briefly submit details demonstrating that you are able to comply with the above minimum criteria.

Name: REQUEST FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST SUPPLY AND DELIVERY OF FLOCCULANT & ACTIVATED CARBON
Scope:
Newmont Ghana, a subsidiary of Newmont Mining Corporation, one of the world’s largest gold-mining companies is requesting for Expressions of Interest from eligible, capable and suitably qualified companies for the provision of the aforementioned services to its Ahafo Mine Operation.  

Potential service providers will be required to demonstrate that they can meet the following minimum criteria for this transaction:
•	Demonstrate capability previous record of successfully providing such supply and delivery,
•	Demonstrate capability previous record of successfully conducting plant trials,
•	Submission of verifiable references to support this capability
•	Robust, effective business processes, standards and procedures, including but not limited to health, environmental, safety, human right, community relations and any other relevant and or applicable standards,
•	The financial strength and ability to provide an uninterrupted supply and delivery on consignment basis.

Please express your interest in participating with Newmont in this bidding process by submitting an e-mail as soon as possible to the address
VendorRegistration@Newmont.com indicating the name of your company, contact person and cellphone contact details.

You should briefly submit details demonstrating that you are able to comply with the above minimum criteria

Expressions of interest should be submitted by close of business Friday October 6th 2017.
MethodOfSubmission: As indicated in the Scope

Name: REQUEST FOR THE EXPRESSION OF INTEREST - PROVISION OF FREIGHT, LOGISTICS AND INTERNAL MAIL MANAGEMENT SERVICES
Scope:
A technology enabled door to door Freight, Mail and Logistics Management Services largely to and from Africa, Australia, Asia,
Western Europe and the USA. The ocean freight ports of entry in Ghana are generally Tema for container cargo and Tema or
Takoradi for break bulk cargo. Air freight traffic is through Kotoka International Airport at Accra
• The financial, infrastructure and human resource capacity to perform all services and make payment for all expenses necessary for the
performance of the Freight, Mail and Logistics Management Services
• The necessary Freight Forwarding Services, coordinating the origin inland transport and collection from Suppliers to the port or airport
of export with the ability to receive, check , package , consolidate and ship via the most cost efficient mode of shipment
• The tool(s) for determination of indicative freight rates (Air, Sea and Courier) to and from key origins
• A 24-hour, all year round dedicated support in-country and offshore to handle any critical requirements of the Companies
• A modern capacity to track and transmit real time shipment data, provide shipping status reports and create shipping documentation
such as packing lists, trucking manifests, commercial invoices and related import and export documentation; analytical reports
determining the overall and unit cost of freight to and from each shipping points and has the strong thirst for continuous improvement
• The capacity to integrate freight and logistics activities into the Companies’ SAP ERP system
MethodOfSubmission: Refer to the attached

Name: SPN FOR THE DEFINITION, PROCUREMENT & IMPLEMENTATION OF GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS) CONSULTANT (AMENDED)
Scope:
The objective of the assignment for the Individual Consultant is to assist MiDA to define, procure, and implement a modern utility GIS for ECG that integrates all location based information into all related business processes and provides the situational awareness required for efficient executive decision-making. Implementation of a utility GIS consist of two parts.  The first part includes the acquisition and installation of the hardware and software that make up the utility GIS and integration of the base utility GIS software with existing applications or systems .
The second part of the scope of implementation of a utility GIS involves collecting data on the physical electric distribution network from existing records or field surveys, validating this data, and populating the installed utility GIS with the data so collected to ensure that the system mirrors exactly the physical system on the ground.
MethodOfSubmission: Interested Individual Consultants are requested to submit their Expressions of Interest, in a sealed envelope and the Financial Offer of the Consultant (Format in Section 4) shall be submitted at the same time as the EOI but in a separate sealed envelope

Name: SPN FOR EXPRESSION OF INTEREST FOR THE DEFINITION, PROCUREMENT & IMPLEMENTATION OF GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS) CONSULTANT
Scope:
The objective of the assignment for the Individual Consultant is to assist MiDA to define, procure, and implement a modern utility GIS for ECG that integrates all location based information into all related business processes and provides the situational awareness required for efficient 
executive decision-making. Implementation of a utility GIS consist of two parts.  
The first part includes the acquisition and installation of the hardware and software that make up the utility GIS and integration of the base utility GIS software with existing applications or systems such as engineering network analytical and design tools like CYMDIST, ASPEN, PSS SINCAL, PLS CAD, etc.; network design tools; SCADA, Customer Information System or Commercial Management System (under implementation in ECG); Asset Management System (AMS) or Computerised Maintenance Management System (CMMS);  etc. The second part of the scope of implementation of a utility GIS involves collecting data on the physical electric distribution network from existing records or field surveys, validating this data, and populating the installed utility GIS with the data so collected to ensure that the system mirrors exactly the physical system on the ground.
MethodOfSubmission: Interested Individual Consultants are requested to submit their Expressions of Interest, in a sealed envelope and the Financial Offer of the Consultant (Format in Section 4) shall be submitted at the same time as the EOI but in a separate sealed envelope

Name: Data Quality Review Consultant
Scope:
The objective of Data Quality Reviews (DQR) is to review the quality of data that will be collected for the Ghana M&E Plan, which will be reported on the MCC website, and to improve the quality of future data gathering and reporting efforts that will included as part of the Ghana M&E plan.  The goal of the DQR is to ensure the quality and accuracy of results reported from the Compact.  The Consultant will be required to review all Compact indicators, data and data collection methodologies with a view to provide MiDA and its Implementing Entities (IEs) with recommendations on how to improve the quality of data used as part of the M&E Plan framework.  As part of the DQR, it is expected that the Consultant will spend time at the data collection, processing and reporting sites required for the M&E Plan indicators.  
The Consultant is encouraged to include a team member from MiDA that will accompany the Consultant’s team to all activities being proposed in their statement of work in order to ensure hands-on training and institutionalization of the data review process. 
The Consultants will review the existing system and processes for generating the relevant data with the view to making recommendation for ensuring that quality data are generated and transmitted on timely basis.
The Consultants will also ensure that MiDA and its partners are compliant with MCC’s Policy for M&E of Compacts and Threshold Programs, MCC Guidelines for Economic and Beneficiary Analysis, MCC Guidance on Common Indicators, and MCC Gender Policy and Gender Integration Guidelines.
MethodOfSubmission: Technical and Financial Proposals shall be submitted in English. Consultants must submit one (1) original and four (4) copies of both the Technical Proposal and the Financial Proposal, in the language(s) specified in PDS ITC 3.1. Proposals shall cover the requirements for the Base Period only.
